item.title: IF you have under
item.dc:creator: @dontreadthis dontreadthis
item.description:
@dontreadthis wrote:

[quote=“Hellz Scape, post:1, topic:283429”]if (playerLevel[playerCooking] < 20) sM("You need 20 cooking to cook this.");

What is wrong with it? I am trying to say if you have under 20 cooking you will get the message “You need 20 cooking to cook this.”

Full code.[/quote]

		}
		if (playerHasItem(335) && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 19) {
			deleteItem(335, 1);
			addItem(333, 1);
			lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();
			addSkillXP(60, playerCooking);
			sM("You cook the trout.");
			setAnimation(883);
} else {
sM(:You need 20 cooking to cook this:); // this tells it that if you dont have over 19 cooking, you will receive this message. Use if, else statements to make things alot easier!
}
}

There ya go

Read full topic

item.title: IF you have under
item.dc:creator: @Hellz_Scape Hellz Scape
item.description:
@Hellz_Scape wrote:

if (playerLevel[playerCooking] < 20) sM("You need 20 cooking to cook this.");

What is wrong with it? I am trying to say if you have under 20 cooking you will get the message “You need 20 cooking to cook this.”

Full code.

		}
		if (playerHasItem(335) && playerLevel[playerCooking] > 19) {
			deleteItem(335, 1);
			addItem(333, 1);
			lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();
			addSkillXP(60, playerCooking);
			sM("You cook the trout.");
			setAnimation(883);
			if (playerLevel[playerCooking] < 20) sM ("You need 20 cooking to cook this.");
